Item 5.03 - Amendments to Articles of In.content: On January 17, 2023, the Board of Directors of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (the “Firm”) adopted amendments to the Firm’s By-laws, effective January 17, 2023 (as so amended, the “By-laws”), to revise and clarify procedural and disclosure requirements for the Firm’s stockholders proposing business for consideration or nominating directors for election at meetings of stockholders, including in order to provide an orderly process in consideration of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission’s recently adopted “universal proxy card” rules.

subsections.enhanced_disclosure_requirements: Adding Sections 1.09(a)(3) and (5) to enhance disclosure requirements for stockholders intending to nominate directors or propose other business ('Proposing Stockholders') at meetings of stockholders, including to: require a Proposing Stockholder’s notice to provide more inclusive disclosures and representations in respect of any proposed nominee; require a Proposing Stockholder’s notice to provide more inclusive disclosures and representations in respect of the Proposing Stockholder, including information about other stockholders or beneficial owners known to be supporting the nomination; and clarifying that certain required disclosures and representations applicable to a Proposing Stockholder also apply to any beneficial owner of stock on whose behalf the nomination is made, and any person acting in concert with the Proposing Stockholder or such beneficial owner.
subsections.nomination_requirements_and_agreements: Adding Section 1.09(a)(6) to require, in connection with the nomination of persons for election to the Board, that: a Proposing Stockholder request required forms of questionnaire, representation, and agreement from the Secretary in writing prior to submitting notice; the notice include the completed questionnaire signed by each proposed nominee; and the notice include signed representations and agreements from each Applicable Person. These agreements include updating disclosures, the nominee meeting with the Firm’s Corporate Governance & Nominating Committee (CGNC) upon request, and providing other representations previously requested only in connection with proxy access.
subsections.additional_information_for_nominees: Adding Section 1.09(a)(7) to clarify that the Firm may, as a condition of any nomination being deemed properly brought, require any Applicable Person to provide additional information that could be required to assess the independence or qualifications of the proposed nominee, or be material to a reasonable stockholder’s understanding of the nominee's fitness, independence, or any past violations of Firm policies.
subsections.proxy_card_and_rule_14a_19_compliance: Amending Section 1.09(c) to require a Proposing Stockholder to use a proxy card color other than white and certify compliance with Rule 14a-19 under the Exchange Act. The changes also clarify procedures for addressing deficiencies in stockholder nominations, including that if a Proposing Stockholder provides notice under Rule 14a-19(b) but fails to comply with Rule 14a-19(a)(2) or (3), the nomination will be disregarded.
subsections.other_amendments: Other amendments to the By-laws include: revising Sections 1.03, 1.04, 1.07, and 1.11 to conform with developments in the Delaware General Corporation Law; revising Section 11.01 to clarify the scope of the Emergency By-laws; and making additional clarifying and conforming revisions.
subsections.summary_qualification: The foregoing description of the amendments to the By-laws does not purport to be a complete summary and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the full text of the By-laws, a copy of which is attached as Exhibit 3.2 and incorporated by reference herein.

subsections.exhibit_list: Exhibit 3.2: By-laws of JPMorgan Chase & Co., as amended, effective January 17, 2023. Exhibit 101: Pursuant to Rule 406 of Regulation S-T, the cover page is formatted in Inline XBRL (Inline eXtensible Business Reporting Language). Exhibit 104: Cover Page Interactive Data File (embedded within the Inline XBRL document and included in Exhibit 101).
